conversation.node: You are among friends here, pilgrim. Stay peaceful.

Then you're not of the faith =player.reflexive=, huh? Me neither. Do go inside, though. She's a beauty. Got dyed glass high in her rafters, she does. And two marvelous carvings on the wings. Plus a light-sculpture of a god. Hear the sermon, too, as you like. The high priest is persuasive, but not half as persuasive as the cathedral herself. In beauty there is power, you know.
Either way, while you're in the cathedral or on the Stiltgrounds, stay peaceful.

Aye, aye. The clamor of it all can overwhelm.
The glowcrows say 'twas a bird-god who taught folks to gather like this, in large flocks. So blame birds.

Who knows? I've wondered it myself. Sometimes she'll catch my eye, when the moon's silver-bright, and she's there bearing down on the flats.
Whatever she is, she's gigantic. And old. Real old. Way older than the cathedral the Mechanimists built inside her.

Are you mad? You think I keep a tally of every shopkeeper that steps foot on the Stiltgrounds? They come and go as they please. You've got merchants of all types here. Winesellers, honey hawkers, bookbinders, cobblers.
Have a look around for =player.reflexive=. Following the road around the Stilt. There's tents the whole way round.

node.text: Live and learn, wanderer. Have you come across any books or scrolls in your travels? Do you care to donate one to the cathedral library? Whenever you return, you may speak to me and read anything you've donated.
node.choice: What use is a library in this salt den? Or in the marshes, strangled by wild plants and poisoned by the glow? Wouldn't a stash of vinereapers serve us better?
Not today. Live and drink, chronicler.

node.text: You imagine they will thrive here at the Stiltgrounds, among the faithful?

This wouldn't be the first time the Stiltgrounds have hosted refugees, =name=, and make no mistake: it is a burden upon the church, Catechists and Protectors in particular. But your words echo loud in our hearts as our hallways. Some in our number will see the slynth as the chosen of chosen, and if I speak to them first, everyone else will take it as Shekhinah's will. Which, arguably, it would be. Tell the slynth that the Mechanimists will have them.

conversation.node: I mean no slight to these slynth folk, =name=, but the Stiltgrounds have hosted refugees before and it is a substantial burden upon our stewards. Our resources and space are scant, and I must request that you find another home for them. May the Kasaphescence shine upon them, and you, in this endeavor.
=name=, bless you. Have you brought tidings of the slynth?

node.text:
Praise be to Shekhinah, =name=, your slynth friends are hard workers and quick learners!
I can't help but feel a bit concerned at their ethic, and who in the church might take advantage of it. I hope to foster an interest in reading in them if I can, before they are taught incuriosity. Perhaps a book club?

Live and learn, =name=.
The slynth are settling in as folk do. I see some flank the Priests and Catechists with empty eye, but some have proven hungry for knowledge. I have established a weekly Canticle study group, and its numbers grow each meeting.
Praise be to Shekhinah for this meeting, =name=.

Oh, we're in but the first phase of its foundation. The church has amassed a splendid collection of scripts through the years. Glorious Shekhinah, praise be upon Him, gifted us with several caches. The eremites work day and night reproducing them in the scriptorium, and I have taken it upon myself to beseech travelers, for the rarest finds often come from the least likely places.
node.choice: What use is a library in this salt den? Or in the marshes, strangled by wild plants and poisoned by the glow? Wouldn't a stash of vinereapers serve us better?

node.text:
You share the pessimism of my kin, and several of the priests as well. My heart hears you, but listen to my words, and maybe you will come to feel as I do.
To devalue wisdom is to devalue the Kasaphescence. She shines in the void, refracting light, illuminating those around her. So does the written wisdom of our elders.
The machinery of chromium is complex in its divinity. Don't we do a disservice to our Fathers when we remain ignorant of it, of our past, of our future? Don't we deserve the joy of knowing? Bless Eschelstadt II, first Child, for he believes as I do.
Peace and health in the light of the Star, pilgrim. Brood with me on the life of Resheph, if you are willing.

A spiritual patron of kith and kin, who did so much for us, and who leads me and others like me to the path of healing. For, above all, he was a healer. He dressed the wounds of the sick and rid the land of the plagues of the Gyre.
He was also a sultan, but he was the last sultan. He unbricked the walls of monocracy so we could pick berries in the orchards they hid.

A quiet shrine to the Coiled Lamb, centuries old. Tucked away here, outside the marble parapets and cloaked in the dust of time, it's lost to those who'd sneer at the veneration of Resheph over other fathers.
Step inside and voice a prayer, if you are willing.

Don't breathe in too deep, =player.formalAddressTerm=, I've set some glue to dry.~ Live and drink, but please do it elsewhere. I fear spills.~ Greetings, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Feel free to examine my books closely.~ Please inspect only the quality of the letters. I am not a librarian.~ These books can weather the salt and jungle alike.~ I assure you, the smell fades once the glue is dry.~ I've books for trade, if you're interested.

Everything I sell is the product of many hours of toil.~ Come closer, so I can see your face.~ Ink runs in my very veins, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ If you're looking to read, I have what you need.~ Please be gentle with the parchment.~ Do be quick, =player.formalAddressTerm=, as I've much work to do.~ Live and drink, reader.

Come here. No, closer. Don't mind the bees, they rarely sting.~ Don't be afraid to approach. The bees rarely sting.~ Care for some beejuice?~ Drink a dram of honey every morning, Slog itself couldn't make you sick.~ You know, bees communicate by dancing. Got a whole language.~ Without bees, all life in Qud would eventually die.~ Bees are smarter than you think. They got that hive mind, see.~ I eat honey matz every morning and I ain't been sick in decades.~ We'd all be dead without bees, you know.

Use your gadgets hard, don't you? I can fix them.~ I can repair, recharge, and identify whatever you have! Within reason.~ If you've got anything you can't make heads or tails of it, give it here.~ You've got to respect a machine. Machines bite harder than any croc.~ You a maker?~ Take out what you've busted and I'll jury-rig it for a fair price.~ Need scrap?~ You get used to the nicks and burns, after years working with spark and solder.~ They say some folks can talk to machines. I say we all can, if we listen right.~ My fees for battery charging depend how empty the battery is when you bring it to me.~ Absolutely no refunds or returns on scrap.

I would prefer not to interrupt this task long.~ How my joints ache! Buy something to justify my pain.~ Unfinished schematics are obviously not for sale. Everything else is.~ Disturb the trash if you must, but do not touch any of my papers.~ Are you a tinker? Surely I have something you wish to build.~ If you've the wits to build, I've got something you want.~ I have lost much to my dedication. Help me gain anew, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ So help me, Argent Fathers, if someone has changed the order of my papers...~ Please, =player.formalAddressTerm=, buy a schematic. I'm sure it will be of use to you.~ Even if you can't make a thing now, you could gain the insight later.

I've the cure for what ails you.~ You don't look so good. You need more yuckwheat and honey in your diet.~ In the market for a tonic, =player.formalAddressTerm=? Spend water now or blood later, your choice.~ Prickly-boons and yuckwheat for trade.~ Cook your meals with yuckwheat if you feel sick. Catch a disease early enough and you can kill it.~ If you came for the humble pie, you had best not have led any mind-hunters here.~ "Ease the pain, addle the brain." Be careful when you chew witchwood bark.~ Don't eat the hoarshrooms too fast, now.~ Have you got enough tonics?~ Got a fungal infection? You'll want one of my spray bottles to apply the cure.~ Got a fungal infection? You'll want one of my spray bottles to apply the cure.~ Get your hands on the Corpus Choliys for disease and fungus cures.~ Get your hands on the Corpus Choliys for disease and fungus cures.

I've the cure for what ails you.~ You don't look so good. You need more yuckwheat and honey in your diet.~ Cook your meals with yuckwheat if you feel sick. Catch a disease early enough and you can kill it.~ "Ease the pain, addle the brain." Be careful when you chew witchwood bark.~ Best not leave town without some bark and bandages, wayfarer.~ Live and drink. Keeping well, I hope?~ How are you feeling today, =player.formalAddressTerm=?~ Moon and sun, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Keeping healthy?

I tell you, =player.formalAddressTerm=, my recipes come from years of experience. There's none the like.~ Finest food for parasangs! Finest food in Qud! Recipes and samples!~ I will share my food-secrets with you, =player.formalAddressTerm=, if you're willing to make it worth my while.~ Do you cook, =player.formalAddressTerm=? So long as you aren't the type to throw whatever local debris you find in the pot, I have wares for you.~ Not a word of lie, I studied under a chef who studied under Agate Severance Star herself. That's why my recipes are the best.~ Try my recipe. You'll believe =player.reflexive= to be judging the Carbide Chefs in the Kitchen Heptagon itself.~ Cookbooks are best named from the heart. Those who ridicule the name of a cookbook have lost their sense of wonder.~ Live and eat, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Live and drink, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

Smell a bit strong? That's how you know it's good.~ You can preserve almost anything. Al... most.~ Preserved ingredients cook better, safer.~ Everything I sell is safe to eat as it is.~ Welcome, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Need vittle?~ Crave a bit of salt, =player.formalAddressTerm=, or a load of salt?~ Nothing sadder than a cookfire and nothing to cook over it.~ Are you a chef, =player.formalAddressTerm=? My vittles are of the highest quality.~ Nourishment for the road, =player.formalAddressTerm=?

Greetings, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Live and drink deeply, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Ah, =player.formalAddressTerm=, please come in.~ My wares are sweet and strong, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Care to try them?~ Tell me, =player.formalAddressTerm=, is there any sight more sad than a hookah tent without wine?~ Wine, cheese, bread. =player.FormalAddressTerm=, tell me, is there anything else you truly need?~ The kipper and I both know that the finest ingredient is time.~ Greetings, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Try some rose wine? One rose is fair, but as you may know from hanging around the Stiltgrounds, five is death.

Liquids...~ Aren't they beautiful, =player.formalAddressTerm=? The bottles, the phials, the light shining through them.~ Live and drink, but not everything. Some things you don't drink.~ Is there any state of form so fine as a liquid?~ Pouring, decanting, collecting, mixing. I adore my calling.~ If it flows, I desire it. You should too, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Do you ever stop and think about fluids? Are they not divine?~ Someday I will plumb the depths of Bethesda Susa, that I may meet the Alchemist.~ Live and drink, and collect, and combine...

Hold, aristocrat! I have wares to claim your interest.~ My implants are acquired peaceably, I assure you.~ How becoming you look, Aristocrat! But you could be more becoming.~ Tire of your legs? Arms? Hands? See what I have that fits you.~ Luxury internal adornments for the discerning Aristocrat.~ No additional sterilisation required, of course.~ Quality implants for sale at reasonable prices!~ You strike me as an Aristocrat who knows the value of artisanal organs.~ I recommend everything I carry. Not all at once, of course.~ Hope you'll "becoming" back, ha ha.~ Live and drink, Aristocrat.

Kill anyone valuable?~ You look dangerous. Ever go hunting for parts?~ Got guts?~ Can you imagine sticking one of these things inside you? Disgusting.~ I've plenty water if you've got implants to sell.~ Always check becoming nook shelves for parts.~ Y'ain't peeled open any Sons or Daughters, have you?~ Less I know about where my stock comes from, the better.~ I'll still take parts you ain't washed off, it's fine.~ If you can butcher a boar, you can do the same to a man. Just ain't meat you're looking for.~ My best customers don't ask questions. My best stock asked too many.~ Live and drink.

Need something to complete your ensemble, =player.formalAddressTerm=?~ With a good hat, =player.formalAddressTerm=, you'll last longer in the salt sun.~ Peruse my wares, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Adorn your head or heads.~ Greetings, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Care for a new topper?~ You need a new hat, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Or a helmet, if that's the life you lead.~ If you're passing through baboon country, you'll want to protect your head, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Live and drink, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

Hello, hello, =player.formalAddressTerm=, let's get your weary feet covered.~ Come in, =player.formalAddressTerm=, and let me 'shoe' you around, ha ha!~ Boots! Shoes! Slippers! Sabatons! How would you prefer to cover your feet, =player.formalAddressTerm=?~ Even as high-quality as my products are, =player.formalAddressTerm=, I don't suggest you go walking in the fracti to test them out.~ Anything you need to ask 'a boot', =player.FormalAddressTerm=? Just a little cobbler's joke, there.~ Hot sands out there, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Is your footwear protecting you?~ Hello, =player.formalAddressTerm=! Care to be shod?~ Walk a few parasangs in my shoes, =player.formalAddressTerm=, and you'll wonder how you ever did otherwise.~ Live and drink, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

Please, =player.formalAddressTerm=, do come in. Take your time browsing my wares.~ Welcome, =player.formalAddressTerm=, to the sole bastion of class in this wretched place.~ Please knock the sand from your feet, =player.formalAddressTerm=. It gets everywhere.~ Ah, =player.formalAddressTerm=, I can certainly help you.~ How may I clothe you, =player.formalAddressTerm=?~ Now, =player.formalAddressTerm=, I know you must have an eye for fashion, if you're here.~ Oh dear. Who dressed you, =player.formalAddressTerm=? Let me help you, please.~ Live and drink, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

{{emote|*silent nod*}}~ Careful. It's hot.~ =player.FormalAddressTerm=. Need protection?~ Be quick about it, eh?~ Greetings.~ Mm?~ I've got my eye on you.~ Leather, ring, and plate, to keep you alive.~ Don't get near the hearth.~ =player.FormalAddressTerm=. Live and drink.

Hand-coats for sale! Spare your digits the indignity of early removal!~ Best protect your hands, =player.formalAddressTerm=. You don't know how much you need them until a madpole takes one.~ Light gloves, heavy gloves, gauntlets. Don't let your hands go bare, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ One size fits all, =player.formalAddressTerm=. If I sell it to you, it fits.~ How do I get my gloves so supple? I'll never tell.~ Moving on soon, =player.formalAddressTerm=? My gloves and gauntlets need no maintenance, so finely are they crafted.~ Live and eat, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Live and drink, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

You can't go wrong with my slugspitters, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Guns, guns, guns! Don't they just make you smile?~ =player.FormalAddressTerm=, I tell you: there is no defense like a good, and distant, offense.~ Ahh, I love the smell of cordite. You know, that sulfury smell? Accelerants make a fine perfume, if you ask me.~ You know, =player.formalAddressTerm=, I once had an traveler from Yawningmoon tell me my shop smelled of home. Now I want to visit! Hah!~ May you find adequate cover and more loot than you can carry, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ I used to be a wayfarer like you, =player.formalAddressTerm=, but old wounds slow you down. Cherish the time while you have it.~ I wish I could allow you to test my wares in the shop, =player.formalAddressTerm=, but walk a parasang in any direction and you'll find a target.~ Might not want to touch anything on the workbenches, =player.formalAddressTerm=.~ Live, drink, and shoot, =player.formalAddressTerm=, in whichever order you like.

Need something blown up, =player.formalAddressTerm=?~ Grenades do no good sitting in a pack. Don't forget to use them.~ =player.FormalAddressTerm=, there is little you can't solve with a well-thrown grenade... as long as you don't stand too close.~ Defoliant and fungicide are perfectly safe, but you may wish to avoid breathing too deeply all the same.~ Can I serve you something explosive, =player.formalAddressTerm=?~ You'll be back, =player.formalAddressTerm=, provided you don't blow =player.reflexive= up.~ Greetings, =player.formalAddressTerm=. Be careful with my wares as you peruse them.~ How is your throwing arm, =player.formalAddressTerm=? Barring that, do you feel lucky?~ It's a dangerous job, =player.formalAddressTerm=, but well worth it.~ The vintners say that 'one rose is fair, but five is death'. I can sell you blossoms that mean death no matter the number.~ Live and drink, =player.formalAddressTerm=.

There's a shape in every stone waiting to be brought out.~ If you bend the light just so, it frays into brilliance.~ I can wait years for the inspiration to craft another figurine. I have before.~ What manner of jewel are our eyes, to skew light into thought?~ Enter, =player.formalAddressTerm=, and behold my jewels and figurines.~ Uncrafted jewels and metals buy and sell for the same cost, but my art's price tag is up to me.~ Every statuette is a tribute, of a kind, but not every tribute is received well.~ Wouldn't these make a fine conversation piece for a water ritual?~ Beautiful baubles and gleaming gemstones over here!

A well-polished and well-picked gem, no matter how rough, is as beautiful a work of art as any figurine.~ Lean in close to see the detail. No, don't touch.~ Within my gemstones there burns a brighter fire than in some hearts.~ Water-wealth means nothing if you cannot carry it. Need jewels?~ Friend, I have precious metals and jewels to adorn or trade.~ Raw metals and gems buy and sell for a fixed water-cost.~ Come, wanderer, change some of that heavy water for a pocketful of riches.~ Water Barons don't adorn themselves with water, after all.

node.text: Oh, I didn't notice you there. That's because I was ignoring you.
{{emote|*mumbling*}} ...waste heat from the thermo cask? Or centrifugal extraction to the p-density of sunslag...

node.choice: Where can I find a cave?

node.text: There are caves everywhere, you dolt! Scoop the surface of the marsh, or head on east to the rust wells, or wander into the Desert for all I care...
node.choice: I will return with your knickknack.

node.text:
{{emote|*Argyve whistles.*}}
Impressive, you! Maybe you're fit to poke around my workshop and swap scrap with me. I have been wanting another apprentice. So unfortunate about Skref, what with the disembowelment and all. Take a seat, there.

{{emote|*Argyve raises both eyebrows.*}}
Now, to screw the nut on the bolt with an explanation! I'm on the cusp, you see. A grand discovery. The Weirdwire Conduit is near assembled, and once it is, we'll be able to chat with anyone... in instant time! from here to the Yd Freehold. But before I can finish, I need wire. As much as you can find... at least two hundred feet. You should be able to scavenge it from the rust wells.

start.text: The wire! Give it to me!

choice.IfFinishedQuestStep: Weirdwire Conduit... Eureka!~Find 200 Feet of Wire

node.text:
{{emote|*Argyve hoots*}}
Yes, yes! Beautiful wire! -oh, before I forget, I repaired an old recoiler for you. Use it whenever you wish to hop back to Joppa quickly. Now, give me a few moments to attach the wire...

choice.CompleteQuestStep: Weirdwire Conduit... Eureka!~Return to Argyve

start.text: It's working! Genius! Genius! Noise in the static- I hear it! I hear!... what's this? What *is* that? Wait...

node.text: It's repeating itself...
{{emote|*Argyve mumbles to himself for several minutes.*}}

Apprentice! Come, here! Something strange is occurring. The Conduit is picking up a signal, some sort of repeating transmission. I cannot decipher it, however. I lack cryptogull eggs and, well, never you mind! I have a great task for you, my apprentice. Do you accept it?
node.choice: Can I know what it is?

node.text: -yes. You must seek out Barathrum the Old, the eldest and wisest tinker alive. He lives with his followers the Barathrumites under the arch of Grit Gate to the northeast, in the jungle-strangled ruins of Qud. He will know what to make of the signal.
node.choice: I require no further information. I will go.

node.text: Disciples of Barathrum. Mostly urshiib, like their mentor- quilled albino bears who prefer their candle-dim caves to the sun-salted surface of the jungle. A thousand years ago Barathrum and his kin crossed the Homs Delta into the rusting heart of Qud. He has spent centuries peeling the chrome shells off time's artifacts in his workshop. If he cannot decipher the signal, no one can.

Splendid! Perfect! Let me record the signal to disk, which you'll need to guard with your life, I'm afraid.
I'll rig up a droid scrambler for you, too. You see, the Barathrumites have programmed a troupe of waydroids to guard the approach to Grit Gate. With the scrambler, you'll needn't worry about them. Wait there.
{{emote|*Argyve mumbles to himself for several minutes.*}}
Here you are. Now, go! Off with you! May you live long enough to do my bidding. Away, away!

start.choice: The Barathrumites say I must plumb a cave called Golgotha before joining them.
Argyve, I am no apprentice. The Barathrumites call me =factionaddress:Barathrumites= now.

start.text: My apprentice! What?

node.text:
Did they, now? Well you're not MY =factionaddress:Barathrumites=!
Grit Gate is not Joppa, you pridesome solder-nail, and in this house you are apprentice still.
Now, what did you want? Be quick!

-what?
No, no, I'm far too engrossed to see to your curiosity. I'm sure the Barathrumites have something for you to do.

Welcome to Grit Gate. I am Otho, Barathrum's steward. I apologize for the manner of our introduction, but we must take precautions. Qud is a very unforgiving place.
You demonstrate tremendous promise to have returned from Golgotha with such inexperience. Take this firearm as your reward. It bears the mark of our finest gunsmith, Sparafucile. Take this bracelet, as well.
Return when you are ready to discuss the signal.

node.text:
It takes more than a willing spirit to be trusted here, wayfarer.
Prove your worth and bring us a waydroid, and we will have more to speak of.
Are you ready to discuss the signal?

The signal is a repeat transmission being broadcast from an unknown source.=V0tinkeraddendum= One of our tinkers, &mQ Girl&y, discovered it while rigging a long wave detector. Unfortunately, it's encrypted, and we do not have the means here to decrypt it. You may be of some help in this matter, however.
We've long known the location of a fully functioning &Wbaetyl&y within the bowels of the great hall &CBethesda Susa&y. The Mechanimists have consecrated the site around it and built a temple there. Q Girl claims to have developed a means to decrypt the signal, but she needs the computing power of the baetyl. If you can infiltrate the Mechanimist compound, you may be able to engage the baetyl and decode the signal.

They are antique stones located in certain places deep within the caverns of Qud. We believe they are some sort of hyper-advanced machines built by the Eaters. Often one claims to possess a sentience of its own. However, most of them have gone haywire in the eons since their creation; it is rare indeed to discover one whose circuitry is wholly uncorroded.
The Mechanimists worship this one as an idol, and they will protect it at all costs. You will need to find a way through their host to the baetyl itself.
Do you believe you can accomplish this task?
node.choice: I must think on this task.

node.text:
Good, =factionaddress:Barathrumites=. Speak to &mQ Girl&y in the workshop. She'll encode her instructions for the baetyl onto a copy of the disk.
There's one more thing. The baetyl is located beneath the ancient cryobarrios of the Eaters. Time has worked to erode the mechanisms that contain their cryogenic mist. That freezing vapor billows out of the chambers freely now, cooling the entire cavern. You will want to procure warm clothing to protect =player.reflexive=.
The spoils of the Mechanimists are yours to keep. Remember, =factionaddress:Barathrumites=, Barathrum will look kindly upon your service.
node.choice: I will return with the data, Steward.

node.text: Luck be with you in the lair of Bethsaida, =factionaddress:Barathrumites=.
node.choice: I will return with the data, Steward.

node.text: You return. Have you succeeded in decoding the signal?
Well done, =factionaddress:Barathrumites=. Present the disk.

choice.CompleteQuestStep: Decoding the Signal~Return to Grit Gate|6000

node.text: I must bring the decoded signal to Barathrum immediately. Return in a few hours. By then I'll have discussed our next course of action with Barathrum and will have further instructions for you.
=factionaddress:Barathrumites|capitalize=, I have no further instructions for you yet. Return soon.
=name=, I've brought the decoded signal to Barathrum, and he's finished musing on it. We have fresh instructions for you, =factionaddress:Barathrumites=. Are you ready to hear them?

Barathrum needs you for an undertaking of great importance. You must journey to &COmonporch&y far to the north. There the Spindle stretches from earth to sky. Unfortunately, a troublesome merchant from the Consortium of Phyta has relocated there and declared xerself Earl of Omonporch. We need you to broker a deal so that we may lease control of the Spindle. Failing that, you'll need to dispose of the self-appointed Earl.
Be careful on your approach to Omonporch, =factionaddress:Barathrumites=. So far east into the reaches of Qud, the Putus Templar lie in wait.
node.choice: What is the purpose of this?
I will secure the Spindle for Barathrum.
I must think on this task.

node.text:
The Putus Templar, or the Sons and Daughters, as they call themselves, are an order of knights who claim descendancy from the Eaters, the ancient folk who wrought the chrome halls of Qud. Beware them, for while they despise all mutants, they harbor a special malice for Barathrum.
Take care that you do not find =player.reflexive= inside one of their slave pens.
node.choice: What is the purpose of this?
I will secure the Spindle for Barathrum.
I must think on this task.

node.text:
That will be revealed to you in due time.
Do not forget your place, =factionaddress:Barathrumites=.
node.choice: I will secure the Spindle for Barathrum.
I must think on this task.

node.text:
It's as I feared, =name=. Grit Gate is being assailed. The Putus Templar must have followed you back from Omonporch.
Let us use the precious little time we have before they arrive to prepare our defenses.
Go to the mainframe room and scan the shale surrounding Grit Gate for anomalies. Now, =name=!

With the chrome key card I gave you, you now have access to our power grid. There are chain laser emplacements and force projectors across the enclave. The world was just unthawing then, and I recall the roar of the freezing water as it rushed through the grotto, and the frigid spray on my face as I watched in awe.

That's my dear friend, Euclid. It's a prattleplant. It stores every phrase it hears in its neuroot network, and it mimics speech by flicking its leaves against one another. What comes out is gibberish as often as not, but even so, it's agreeable company for my nights spent tinkering. It is old, perhaps older than I am, and it hasn't yet run out of things to say.

You see, nestling, in the earliest aurora of our past, the Eaters of Earth were joined by a great coven of beings that spanned the firmament. But the Eaters succumbed to some terrible temptation, and an injunction was placed on our world.
Since then, the stars were silent to us, and our world was left to molder and decay. But something changed. The signal affirms that an entity roosts atop the Spindle, and invites us to join it.
Dare I say, is the injunction at an end? It's too early to tell, but alas, there could be hope for our world.

Pax Klanq is an eccentric mushroom prodigy. All their faults aside, they are a brilliant scientist and engineer, and I have little doubt that they could build the climber faster than we could. Several years have passed since we were last in contact, but they owe us a debt, and we must now collect.

Professor Cones taught me everything about finding evidence!
Though evidence you found upon the ground may yet be sound, If it will be sufficient is a toss-up. Examine all your suspects and their homes and all around, And find a witness who may dish the gossip.
You can find evidence by looking at things on the ground, but you can also look at your suspects to see if there's anything off about them. You can also ask around to see if anyone has seen or heard anything strange, and different witnesses may have different things to report.

Evidence is any sign of something gone amiss. The Great Plant Detective gave some good examples in Act II of the tragedy of Gimlet:
So! Sweep the full estate for signs of {{W|trade}}, their shady night-time dealings to expose Now look for signs of {{W|craft}}, see what was made For to conceal a treasure hidden close. But darker still, if {{W|illness}} signs we find A desperate contagion may yet lurk And darkest yet, more {{W|violence}} may reply To those who stumble 'pon their grisly work.

node.text:
Implicating evidence is what it sounds like: evidence that implicates someone's involvement in a crime. For example, if someone observed strange behavior in a person, or if you found something weird in a person's room, or even if you observe them behaving strangely =player.reflexive=! That's implicating evidence.
Most of the time, a piece of implicating evidence isn't proof of a crime in and of itself, but when presented alongside supporting evidence, implicating evidence is the seed of truth from which grows the long frond of justice.

node.text:
Supporting evidence can be any sign that something is amiss that you can't directly tie to an individual. One common example is a bloodstain, which indicates that violence was committed but doesn't tell you by whom.
At its heart, supporting evidence is most powerful when paired with implicating evidence. Once you have both, you'll be in a good position to accuse a suspect of wrongdoing.
